metadata.genres: [rnb, pop, soul, Alternative R&B, Left-Field Pop]
metadata.bio: Taylor Monet Parks (born September 16, 1993), also known by the stage name Tayla Parx, is an American singer-songwriter, and actress. In 2018, Parks was credited as a co-writer on four Billboard Hot 100 top 10 singles;  "Love Lies" by Khalid and Normani, "Thank U, Next" and "7 Rings" by Ariana Grande, and "High Hopes" by Panic! at the Disco.
